Dear Holt Public,

Yesterday, we reported that one of the Chromebook orders we placed in May had yet to arrive. This is an issue affecting schools across the nation. We later learned this week that some families left their assigned material and Chromebook pick-up time without a device. I am happy to report that for families still in need of a Chromebook, K-8th grade building principals will be reaching out to schedule a device pick-up time! We are still working on the final details of our high school device pick-up plan. We apologize for this inconvenience. While the devices we are deploying today are not new, they will provide a bridge to a newer device once they arrive. We remain committed to making sure your child has the tools needed for their academic success in these challenging times!

Be Well!

post_text: Calling all students interested in a possible energy career: #DidYouKnow that Holt Public offers the tools to connect you to a career in the energy industry? In partnership with @Michigan Energy Workforce Development Consortium, Consumers Energy, UWUA Power 4 America Trust Fund, Lansing Board of Water & Light. Holt High School students can sign up for a class called Energy Industry Fundamentals that enables them to get hands-on experience in the energy industry during their senior year. Students are able to gain the skills and knowledge necessary for these types of careers in flexible learning environments. This program allows students to apply hands-on learning onsite at Power 4 America and can lead to a work-based learning placement with Consumers Energy or Lansing Board of Water and Light. The Energy Industrial Fundamental program at Holt High School is the first step for students into a high-demand, high-wage career. There are only three seats left for the class in the fall. Find more information and sign up here: http://bit.ly/SecondaryPrograms

Holt Public Schools strives to innovate, educate, and inspire our students to be the next great leaders in a 21st-century economy, utilizing Xello is one tool that can help our students in that pursuit.

#DidYouKnow Holt Public Schools has a Student Leadership Club to help them excel in the business world? Each year, many Holt students participate in DECA Inc., an organization that seeks to “prepare emerging leaders and entrepreneurs in marketing, finance, hospitality, and management.” Students who participate develop these skills through academic conferences and competitions throughout the year.

“DECA is an amazing program for business-focused students, as well as anyone looking to obtain better leadership skills. One of my favorite parts of the DECA program at HHS is the trip to Detroit for the State competition. You meet amazing mentors and students while growing closer with your teammates,” said Holt participant Jacob Toomey.

Students 9th through 12th grade who are enrolled in a Business Technology course can sign up. If you are interested, talk to a Business Technology teacher at the high school or check out http://bit.ly/SecondaryPrograms for more information.

Beginning with their sophomore year, this hands-on approach allows students to see their education and hard work materialize in a final project during their senior year. To learn more, check out Mrs. Weise’s Project Lead the Way blog: http://weisepltw.weebly.com/blog

post_text: Calling all students interested in a possible energy career: #DidYouKnow that Holt Public offers the tools to connect you to a career in the energy industry? In partnership with Michigan Energy Workforce Development Consortium, Consumers Energy , UWUA Power 4 America Training Trust Fund, Lansing Board of Water & Light. Holt High School students can sign up for a class called Energy Industry Fundamentals that enables them to get hands-on experience in the energy industry during their senior year. Students are able to gain the skills and knowledge necessary for these types of careers in flexible learning environments. This program allows students to apply hands-on learning onsite at Power 4 America and can lead to a work-based learning placement with Consumers Energy or Lansing Board of Water and Light. The Energy Industrial Fundamental program at Holt High School is the first step for students into a high-demand, high-wage career. There are only three seats left for the class in the fall. Find more information and sign up here: http://bit.ly/SecondaryPrograms
